wikipedia_page.main: Professor Dame Linda Partridge  (born 18 March 1950) is a British geneticist, who studies the biology and genetics of ageing (biogerontology) and age-related diseases, such as Alzheimer's disease and Parkinson's disease. Partridge is currently Weldon Professor of Biometry at the Institute of Healthy Ageing, Research Department of Genetics, Evolution and Environment, University College London, and Founding Director of the Max Planck Institute for the Biology of Ageing in Cologne, Germany.

Michael John Morgan FRS (born 25 August 1942 in Cardiff, Wales) is a Professor at City, University of London.. His area of research is the experimental psychology of vision, from neuroanatomy to perception and psychophysics.  He was educated in Cowbridge Grammar School and Queens' College, Cambridge. He was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society in 2005.  He is married to the biologist Linda Partridge FRS.

link_mentions.page: Max Planck Institute for Biology of Ageing
response: Since the beginning of the research work in 2008 Adam Antebi (USA), Nils-Göran Larsson (Sweden) and Linda Partridge (UK) are jointly directing the institute. In 2018 Thomas Langer (Germany) was appointed as the fourth director of the institute. The Larsson Department has since resigned from the institute. Anne Schaefer (Germany) was appointed as a Director in 2021.
